This was my 2nd ever half life game and i love it shepherd is a really interesting character and the game play is really fun and the combat is amazing along with all the weapons you can unlock all i can say is hes one of my top tier favorite  game characters now. Plus the story really did fit in well but what was funny is the Vietnam/saving private Ryan scenes i had in the game so yeah I highly recommended it if your getting into the half life genre.

我在原版里和Marine交火的时候就在想，这些士兵也是在执行命令而已，我却不得不把他们杀了，他们为了上级肮脏的秘密而牺牲，很难受。
而这部资料片就刚好以Marine的视角重新讲这个故事，让我们亲身体验一回，作为政府的expendable property，在为你效力的上级收拾烂摊子时却被无情抛弃，是个什么感受。
增加了狙击步枪、机关枪、藤壶怪绳索等武器，种类很丰富，每一种都有适用的场景。
通关后和Half-Life原版一样，G-Man找你谈话，然后黑屏警告，需要手动退出。

唯一不爽的地方：突击步枪在远距离时精度不如手枪和狙击步枪，近距离时输出不如霰弹枪，打小怪费子弹太多，打大怪又不如放射性物质枪那样可以直接秒，准星颜色还那么不明显，根本不知道自己瞄到哪儿了！总之很鸡肋。
Takes me back to the days of no worries just playing games and having fun. would recommend this game even if it's just for the memories.

[quote=author] [b] Diğer oyunlar ile ilgili incelemelerime / indirim duyurularına ulaşmak için [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37884261/] buraya [/url] tıklayın. [/b] [/quote]

Half Life ın bir diğer DLC si diyebileceğimiz Opposing Force'da  Gordon'u ortadan kaldırmak için Black Mesa'ya gelen askerlerden birisini oynadığımız bir oyun.

Askerlere bilim adamlarını kurtarmaya gidiyoruz deniliyor ve bu amaçla yola çıkıyoruz, yolda helikopterimiz saldırıya uğrayıp çavuş öldükten sonra aslında gerçek amacımızın Black Mesa'yı temizlemek olduğunu öğrenemiyoruz. Bu nedenle karakterimiz oyundaki askerlerin bilim adamlarını öldürdüğünü gördüğünde çok şaşırıyor.

Oyunda ilk defa Half Life için yeni silahlar ve yeni düşman tipleri geliyor. Silahları ve düşmanları  ilk gördüğünüzde çok şaşırabilirsiniz. Oyuna çok güzel yedirilmiş.

Yaklaşık 4 saat süren bu oyun ile Black Mesa'yı bir kez daha ziyaret etmeyi ihmal etmeyin.

Ulan Gaben nerde HL3!!

its alright i guess

I can really tell why this is everyones'  favorite DLC for Half Life. There is just so much content and story given to you, the player, in such a short amount of time. If I didn't know that Half Life even existed, I would think that this was its own game. Don't make me talk about the myriad of weapons included. All of these new weapons are all so unique and so different. Of course we have some weapons coming back from Half Life; like the 9mm pistol; or how about the shotgun. I just love how at  some point, you can hear/see Gordon Freeman being dragged away while some soldiers talk about murdering him. The only problems I have with the game is some features that aren't really told to the player; Like how you could climb up robes and cords n' such. I'm not sure if they talked about this in the Boot camp, but whatever. Another thing that makes me sad is how Valve, or Gearbox, or anyone for that matter hasn't done anything else with Adrian Shepherd. There's just this cool/edgy protagonist waiting to be used....
awesome extension of the original halflife game...the new weapons and levels make the game even better!
SUPER GOOD i cant even explain JUST BUY IT

A good addition to the main game and story; it was neither repetitive nor reductive. I was impressed with the new weapons and aliens, I genuinely enjoyed playing through this. It didn't glitch out on me like Blue Shift, but it did crash twice, which is fine.
i hope to see Adrian Shepherd in the next Half-Life

Started playing this 1st on my road to Half-Life: Alyx, followed by Blue Shift and finally Half-Life: Source.

This slice of the Half-Life story felt very complete, definitely worth playing through if you're already going to play the original Half-Life. The game follows the original plot from the perspective of the forces opposing Gordon Freeman and the Black Mesa scientists. 

As DLC to Half-Life, this is just more of an already good game and more than worthy of being its owning expansion. It bring the same fun gameplay and challenges to the table while offering the base game's story from a different perspective. Certain story components and in-game dialogue branch over from the base game and makes for neat moments that remind you of whats going on elsewhere in Black Mesa. Campaign is about half as long as the base game, well worth the time.
its great

I purchased the Half-Life bundle after finishing Half-Life 1. This expansion was a beautiful addition to the original game. I enjoyed the entire play-through. 

The game took me about half the amount of time to complete than the first game. Still, the experience was so engaging I would have gladly paid more. 

If you enjoy Half-life, pick this up. If you haven't played a half-life yet, purchase Half-Life 1 and come back. You'll want this expansion guaranteed. On to Half-Life: Blue Shift for me. Cheers!

Dobry dodatek do HL1. Nie taki rewelacyjny jak oryginał, ale nowe bronie oraz nowa, stworzona na potrzebę dodatku tajemnicza Rasa X robią swoje. Po 5 godzinach gry ukończyłem ją bez większego problemu. Zaskoczyłem się, ponieważ myślałem, że jestem dopiero w połowie. Jak dla mnie gra 7.5/10. Polecam osobą którzy ukończyli HL1, ale także takim, którzy z serią mają styczność pierwszy raz.

[h1]Quick Summary[/h1]
Half-Life: Opposing Force is overall a good expansion to the original Half-Life game. Obviously it's recommended that you play Half-Life before playing this expansion. New weapons and monsters are introduced as you fight your way through Black Mesa during the incident infamously started by Gordon Freeman. Of course, the game is old and doesn't hold up graphically, but the gameplay is still pretty tight. It feels more like a corridor shoot-em-up than a continuation of any story, as it's told from a different perspective of an event we already know about.

[h1]My Full Review[/h1]
I recommend this game overall to any active or soon to be Half-Life fans. If you're looking to learn something new about the story, this isn't it. This expansion is more dedicated to the gun play than anything else. The puzzles aren't too hard to figure out, and the environments aren't anything you haven't really seen in Half-Life. The encounters are quite brutal and a lot of trial and error is involved.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
There are plenty of new weapons to use as you make your way through the game. With more weapons comes a LOT of enemies per level. You'll spend a lot of time using cover and peeking to get shots off on some of the tough enemies, as they tend to sponge a lot of damage and hit hard.

Puzzles are present, however they aren't too difficult. I suggest learning how to crouch jump if you're not familiar, because there are a lot of areas that assume you'd know how to do this. There are some sections that aren't immediately obvious as to what you should do either, so keep an eye on all of your options on how to traverse a situation.

The game is obviously old and you'll notice parts that are rough around the edges, most notably when interacting with ropes, the grapple hook, physics interactions, and the AI. My biggest issue was the boss fight. After fighting your way to the end, the boss fight is laughably easy and kind of boring.

[h1]Story / Plot[/h1]
You're playing in the perspective of Adrian Shepard, a US Marine Corporal who's assigned to the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit. You don't receive the full briefing of your upcoming mission and end up running through Black Mesa during the infamous incident started by Gordon Freeman from Half-Life.

The gameplay doesn't translate to the story very well, as it's as simple as, "Adrian fights his way out of Black Mesa." You'll see plenty of easter eggs and nods to the first Half-Life to help indicate the timeline of events. Otherwise, there's not much to say about this game for the story. You'll be playing Half-Life: Opposing Force for the gameplay more than anything. If you're not interested in more Half-Life gameplay as much as more story, I suggest just looking up a synopsis on YouTube.

[h1]Graphics / Audio[/h1]
For a game initially released in 1999, it's understandable that the graphics and audio aren't going to hold up to standards found in 2020. With that aside, the graphics are still quite interesting as they were in Half-Life. I did find it pretty obvious as to which assets were added in Half-Life: Opposing Force, because they had a different feel about them that didn't quite match Half-Life in some ways. The graphics overall hold a fantastic grungy sci-fi aesthetic and work perfectly for the game.

The audio is... not good. It absolutely doesn't hold up in any way. The sounds are definitely nostalgic and worked well for the time, but the voices sound strangely robotic and the guns are obnoxious. There's also a moment towards the end in a storage facility where boxes are moving on a rail, and the sound gets so loud that all other sounds distorted unpleasantly. Audio isn't the strong suit in this game, or any of the original Half-Life games.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Pick this game up if you really enjoyed the gameplay found in Half-Life. If you're looking for additional story material, there's not much here that warrants the playtime. Expect the old age of this game to provide some rough moments, but take time to appreciate the craft of the past. Half-Life was no easy feat, and even today, it still shows.

[h1]Please Rate This Review[/h1]
I spend a lot of time breaking down game design and development from a critical consumer's perspective. If you've read all the way through, please give it a rating. The feedback helps!

If you enjoyed playing the original Half Life you'll enjoy playing this. It's a bit more streamlined and action-oriented than the main storyline. It ties into the main story in some interesting ways. The ending is better than the original game's. Definitely one of the best expansions I've ever played.

A worthy expansion for the original Half-Life, it has new aliens to shoot at, new weapons to play around with, and an all-new protagonist to explore his perspective from. 

If you played the original Half-Life first before the expansion (like you should, to be fair), you can feel a bit guilt tripped in this expansion, as the side you are playing on is not exactly the good one. 

Nevertheless, it was plenty of fun, and I enjoyed it pretty much. The perfect expansion if you need more Half-Life.
